channel.title: iDigital

item.title: As Trump badgers Fed to lower rates, it’s the bond market in need of convincing

item.title: I’m 51, earn $129K and have $165K in my 401(k). Can I afford to retire when my husband, 59, draws Social Security at 62?
item.description: “He is retired from a state job and receives a pension that nets around $3,600 per month, as well as lifelong health insurance for both of us.”

item.title: Trump pledged not to cut Medicare — but his budget bill does just that
item.description: The GOP megabill now under Senate consideration threatens healthcare insurance for more than 1 million seniors who rely on Medicare.
